alert.note: Alert for Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:39PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Randolph County through 415 PM EDT... At 339 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Albany, or 11 miles south of Dunkirk, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Randolph County, including the following locations... Farmland, Ridgeville and Saratoga. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for east central Indiana.
